top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Can confirm did same thing with my 2017 Honda Accord, leased for three years, bought out at the end. Thing has 25k on it right now, thanks covid 😂. Could have made a few grand on selling it at the time, might be able to still. 0 down, 200 a month, was kinda the best lease deal for me at the time. 

Always double check real quick on sites that buy cars too for an easy flip if you’re not comfortable doing private sales!
